title: Lay
author: Mason Griswold
poem: I don't typically lay on this side to write.
I have my right hand holding my head
As if it's some grand prize of importance.
I Will Follow You into the Dark is playing
But only through half my skull.
Ben's voice is much too soft to penetrate
The grey matter of my mind.
That I can no longer understand it.
Maybe if I lay the other way
I could hear the notes from my heart.
His voice could sink into the other half.
Maybe if I lay the other way.
